Author: jkush
Content:
I've also wondered if "karma" as defined here is anything like real world karma (if there is such a thing).

What I mean is: Does upvoting a comment or submission effect your own karma points? Have the folks on the leader board also upvoted a lot? Is there any correlation at all?

Author: wensing
Content:
Excellent article, and the illustrations do a fantastic job of visualizing your points.

I agree with your assertion, by the way. However, it does take something 'extra' (the "if you really want to spend money" part at the bottom) to make something into a total social phenomenon. That said, I still believe the magic sauce could be inventing something that is just so downright amazing (ex.: a perpetual motion machine) that people (and the news) must talk about it. That is the dream-stricken inventor in me, at least.

Author: pg
Content:
This is strangely addictive.  I still haven't figured out
exactly why.

Author: jgamman

Author: seekely
Content:
User upload will be coming in the near future. At least for images. For now, we wanted to push out something that was dead simple and involved as few steps to create something as possible.

On another note, our more powerful and feature rich online music animator, currently in the works, completely revolves around user created and uploaded content.

Author: epi0Bauqu
Content:
Sorry, but you are generally wrong. What I think you are talking about is called piercing the corporate veil: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piercing_the_corporate_veil

Under almost all regular circumstances, including the example you mention, you most likely wouldn't be held personally liable. You have to do something grossly negligent or something clearly in bad faith. An example would be committing fraud.

Author: epi0Bauqu
Content: How do you know you "aren't in a position that you're going to get sued?"
